Reviews.Title: Another great camera from Nikon
Reviews.Author: Person
Reviews.Content: I have had a Nikon Coolpix S600 for 5-6 years now and it has been my go to camera to have around because of it's handy size and it has never let me down, except that recently the zoom function is intermittently working.  So, I decided to replace it with the S9500 and just got it this past week and really wanted to put it through the paces a bit to see how functional it would be around town and in the field.The wi-if transfer is really handy when your out and about and want to transfer photos to a cell phone or tablet that has data capability so they can be uploaded to a website or to just back them up on another device.  I used my iPad and the free app from Nikon called Wireless Mobile Utility (WMU) which can be found in the App Store, it's really quick and easy to use. It also allows you to setup your camera and remotely take pictures with the app, I found that I could only be about 30 feet away from the camera with my iPad before the wi-if signal was lost so it has range limitations.The 22x zoom is fantastic for this size of a camera, it takes really nice clear photos even zoomed all the way out.  The anti vibration works well also if you al moving about and taking action shots.One big complaint I have so far is the placement of the record button for starting video recording.  I have hit this button numerous times on accident and there is no way to disable the video record function, it's always at the ready when you are in photo mode.

Reviews.Title: Firmware update could make this camera great
Reviews.Author: Dave L
Reviews.Content: In the couple of weeks I've had the camera, I've really enjoyed it. In good light, it takes great pictures with vibrant colors and the flash works very well. The menu system is well designed which provides easy access to all of the camera's functions. I especially like the GPS features and panorama and 3D modes. Of course, the 22x zoom is great.One big problem however is the cameras operation in even moderately low light situations. There are times when it refuses to focus even in normal indoor lighting especially when the zoom is being used. This prevents even taking a flash photo. It's especially frustrating since it seems to start out with a good focus and then veers away from it when it locks in. I'm hoping this is just a bug that could be fixed in firmware. My son's camera from a competitor works perfectly every time in identical situations.The omission of an AC adaptor that allows operation of the camera (in addition to charging) is baffling. The cumbersome battery substitute adaptor is a poor alternative to this obvious feature. Not a deal breaker though.Most importantly, certain basic functions are missing from the firmware. It's as if a marketing guy told the engineers to get rid of every extra item that could confuse a user rather than sensibly tucking them away into a separate area for when the user gains more experience. Here is a list of seemingly simple changes that I hope find their way into a firmware update before I have to decide whether to return the camera:1. Get rid of the GPS log warning when powering down or at least let the user dismiss it. Waiting 10 seconds before you can put it back in your pocket gets annoying very quickly.2. Provide basic shutter and aperture priority modes. The camera often makes wrong decisions, especially in dim light, and this would provide a fallback.3. Provide additional focus modes for infinity (without having to be limited to a landscape scene) and maybe a distance focus control for situations where the automatic modes don't work. This may not be necessary if the engineers can get the low light focusing to work properly.4. Allow control over how long the preview shows after taking a picture.5. Allow edited images (zoomed, softened, etc) to be transferred via wifi. The instructions don't say they can't be transferred but they are disabled with an X through them on my iPhone with the Nikon app.6. Allow full res images to be transferred to a smart phone via wifi.There are probably more missing basic features but these are the ones I noticed right away. The first three especially are reason enough to return the camera if they are not fixed. It would be a shame for such a great camera to be hobbled by substandard firmware. Since I generally enjoy using the camera, I really hope Nikon is listening and has the technical skills to fix the problems.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For My Use
Reviews.Author: Elliott
Reviews.Content: I will probably update after more use (especially in low light situations), but so far this camera is great for what I will use it for.  I love concerts so that is my main point of having a camera and then for family/friend get togethers.  I love the zoom on this camera and the many functions it comes with.  I can easily and quickly touch up photos right on the camera, which is a great function.  The GPS is there too, if needed, but I haven't really had the need to test that out.  It powers on quick, there are several settings to choose from, the look and feel of the camera is great!  I'm not too fond of where the flash is because I always end up putting my finger there to take a picture and have to remove it for the flash to come up, but that's just a habit I'll have to start putting my finger elsewhere!I originally went in to buy the Nikon P510 because I heard that was great in low light and has amazing zoom, but it was just too big for me at this time.  Maybe down the road I'll go toward that size, but it's not for me right now and was informed the S9500 had really good zoom and low light qualities as well.Two reasons for the 4 stars are:You have to charge the battery IN the camera.  The camera doesn't come with an external battery charger.  I had to buy an external charger (another $20) that plugs directly into the wall without the cord to charge the battery outside of the camera.  Nikon does sell an external batter charger for this but it's a charger that has a 4 ft cord that plugs into the wall case that came with the camera, again, not very functional unless you don't mind a long cord to charge your battery.  The cord for me would have sufficed if I couldn't find a different charger, but I did.  This comes in a few days so if it works, great!  If not, then I will go back and get the corded charger.The second reason is the WiFi.  Not a deal breaker for me, but it seems to be a bit finicky and doesn't stay connected very long.  The app needed for the WiFi isn't the greatest and the functions are very limited and you will need to set the settings on your camera to where they need to be before connecting WiFi because once WiFi is on, you cannot change settings on your camera (unless I'm missing something), only through your phone and those functions are limited to zooming in and out and is not quick at all.  It also took me some time to get the WiFi to connect, but I think this was because the instructions on it weren't the clearest.Overall, great camera for what I will use it for and the WiFi and battery aren't deal breakers for me.  I will update later once I put it to test in a concert setting.Update 4/28/13:  I took this camera to a concert last night and was rather impressed.  It took great pictures in the low light and the zoom is awesome!  I didn't zoom to the fullest as it wasn't needed, but am impressed.  And my battery was hardly used at all and I took about 100 pictures within a matter of a few hours.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Suzanne S
Reviews.Content: Love this camera right out of the box. It is replacing a Coolpix S8000 (the lens got scratched) which takes amazing pictures. The S9500 does everything the 8000 did and has a few new features that just make it so much fun! If you are used to a Nikon you will find it very easy to navigate. As a point and shoot camera it is a wonderful compliment to a DSLR (I shoot with a D300s). Sometimes you just want to travel light with a small camera that still allows you some control and flexibility. This camera also has a terrific wide angle to zoom lens which allows you to get the shot where ever you go. I haven't used the wifi feature yet but did want to share my enthusiasm for this camera!

Reviews.Title: Love the camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Elliot
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about 5 days, using it every day with great results.  I would second all the positive things the posters above have said.  But today, the WiFi stopped working.  If I take out the battery and put it back in, it works again, but only for a few seconds.  I took 2 stars away for the hassle of having to send it back and wait for a new one.  I hope this is not a recurring problem.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth/Michael
Reviews.Content: First S9500 went back before we could even use it.  The battery wouldn't hold a charge longer than a day.  We thought, and still think it was a problem with the charging cord.Got a second one and took that S9500 on a two week trip.  We used it constantly so had a good opportunity to see results under repeated use.  Although this second one did much better on the battery charge, occasionally, it would register low or no battery and then turn off when it should have been charged.  Maybe this was a charging cord issue again (?)Sometimes too, we would have the opposite problem where it wouldn't turn off and we would have to turn it over and remove the battery to get it to turn off.The round dial on the top next to the shutter button that allows you to change the settings ie.  portrait, landscape etc. was a constant source of problems as well.  Ultra sensitive, putting it in and pulling it out of the case or handing it to another person could easily change the setting and we have lots of blurry pictures from the settings dial moving without our notice.With the exception of dial setting errors, pictures from the trip are crystal clear, the slim, lightweight design of the camera made it easy to tote around and pull out when needed.  The display monitor was great and the camera had more functions than I could ever begin to use but in the end, we weren't willing to put up with the little annoyances so it went back.

Reviews.Title: Even better than the S9100!!!
Reviews.Author: TAF
Reviews.Content: I had the S9100 camera, and this one is even better.  Easy enough to use for a complete noob, but with enough features that a somewhat advanced hobbiest can play with a lot of functionality.My level is wanting a great shot (often from a great distance) without having to carry around a giant bag of lenses and such.We took our S9100 on vacation to Alaska, and all the people with their $1000+ cameras were getting no better shots than we were, and we didn't have to change lenses, so didn't miss shots up-close or far-distant. In addition, we got HD video of the trip as good as fancy video cams!  (Just remember to change the video focus mode to continuous so that you can zoom in and out while taking video and the focus will adjust as you zoom.)  The dedicated video record button is a huge bonus, because it means you don't have to switch modes or dials or menu options to go straight from snapping a photo to recording a video.  We caught wildlife views that no one else could by one quick button press to record video.The S9500 is all this and more, with GPS tagging and increased Zoom to 22x.Bonus for me is that it takes the same EN-EL12 batteries as my S9100 took, so the extra batteries that I have fit it perfectly.My recommendation... get this camera...  Get the Square Trade Accident Protection Plan  purchase about 6 extra EN-EL12 batteries  get a Universal Digital Camera Charger for Li-Ion Batteries (charges many types of camera batteries with a wall plug and car plug included)  get 5 to 10 SDHC 8gb (or 16gb) "Class 10" (this allows high speed video to record longer) cards  a good quick access camera case  and "GGS Optical Glass LCD Screen Protector 3 inches for Digital Cameras" to protect the LCDSo what happened to my S9100?  It slipped out of my hand and hit the pavement on the only unprotected corner that my camera case didn't cover.  After getting a refund because they couldn't fix it from a big-box electronics store (after almost a year of them having my camera), I chose Amazon to buy the S9500 because the Square Trade Accident plan would have had my camera back or money to me in a very short time, and the Accident plan is much better than I could find anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: Camera Freezes After a Few Shots
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Dixon "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get this camera as I'd had earlier versions of this Coolpix series and overall they are great cameras.  It takes a good photo and is easy to use.  But after using it for about 2 weeks, it started freezing after taking a few shots.  I'd have to take the battery out to reboot and after that it would work for a few shots.  The problem is getting progressively worse and I'm sending it back today for repair.  For it's class this is a relatively expensive camera and it's disappointing to find this problem with the Nikon.  Now in surfing the net I see that this is a more systemic problem than a one off outlier as I see others are reporting this too.

Reviews.Title: Focus problems in low light
Reviews.Author: S. Pollock
Reviews.Content: When I first got the camera, I really liked it.* The zoom lens is excellent, I got some nice shots of birds and buildings* The macro works well; got nice shots of wildflowers; great color, etc.* The panorama feature worked well about 50% of the time.However, when I tried to use it indoors after a while I went from happy to frustrated quickly.  In a museum (with low but sufficient light), the camera just wouldn't focus within 5 feet (for example to take shots of placards instead of taking notes, or of various carvings).  I tried with no zoom, tried all the autofocus modes, then ultimately reset to factory defaults.  This helped a little bit, but still ended up with a lot of out of focus pictures.  There seemed to be a manual focus mode, but I couldn't figure it out.So the camera went back...It's great for outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Sammy
Reviews.Content: Even better camera than expected.  Zoom is phenomenal and picture clarity is awesome.  Have yet to find a situation that it will not take a great picture.

Reviews.Title: Batter problem
Reviews.Author: KathleeG
Reviews.Content: The camera battery will not stay charged. Put it into the camera and it looks as if it is fully charged and within 10 photos it dies. I ordered 2 additional batteries and they do the same things. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Achilles' Heel
Reviews.Author: AaronAbasolo
Reviews.Content: This camera has a BIG weak spot, you cannot charge one battery while using the camera with a second battery, since the battery has to be IN THE CAMERA to charge it using the included charger, which is just a USB power supply which connects to the camera via a non-standard USB connector. To add inslt to injury, the supplied USB cable has a heavy ferrite noise-suppressor "lump" in it, making it bulky to carry.I'm returning it, and I'll buy a Fuji or Panasonic, which come with simple one-piece plug-in chargers with fold-out prongs, which allows you to leave one battery charging while you are using the camera with a second battery. Nikon apparently thinks you'll shell out another $25 for this type of charger, which should come with the camera in the first place!In addition, others have complained about poor focusing in low light, and that the wi-fi will only transfer low-res versions of your photos, not your full-res originals.

Reviews.Title: Not Good!
Reviews.Author: K. Lee
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to upgrade from the Coolpix camera I have now and when I got it, it was very cheaply made and made a clicking sound when not in use. Sent back immediately.

Reviews.Title: The battery was defective, and Nikon doesn't seem to care
Reviews.Author: captain america
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement camera for my wife's. She rarely uses a camera, but her previous one would keep a charge for multiple weeks. With this one, the battery ran out in a matter of hours. By the time I realized there was a problem (it took multiple weeks, and then further weeks for me to act on it), it was too late to return it to Amazon, and I had to deal with Nikon support... Here is the transcript below. For those who don't want to bother read it all, it basically says: "tough luck you received a bad battery, just buy a new one".=====Customer via Web 09/29/2013I have hardly been able to take any pictures due to the fact the battery runs out in a matter of hours after full charge. I use the camera very seldom (I have it with me in my bag to snap pictures of the kids every now and then) and every time I have wanted to use it, the battery has run out. This is not hapenning with any other camera I have (including my Nikon D80).=====Response Christine C. via Email 10/01/2013Hello Mr. xx,Thank you for contacting Nikon Customer Support. It sounds to me that the battery is exhausted and needs to be replaced. I would recommend purchasing a new approved battery for your S9500 and the issue should be resolved.Answer Title: Battery, Charger and AC Adapter CompatibilityAnswer Link: [...]Please click on the link above with Nikons contact information, if you have any further question.=====Customer  via Web 10/02/2013Don't you think you should send me a new battery? This problem has occurred since day one, and I hope I am not expected to purchase a new battery with a brand new camera?=====Response Christine C. via Email 10/02/2013Hello Mr. xx,Thank you for contacting Nikon Customer Support. Batteries are not covered under the one year manufacture warranty but if you feel the battery is defective you can send it in for service to be evaluated.All Nikon cameras(Chargers) come with a one year manufacturers warranty and Nikkor lenses have a 5 year warranty that covers manufacturing issues only. Any issue caused by physical, sand, or liquid damage is not covered as these occurrences void the warranty. All Nikon digital products sold by Nikon Inc. have a standard one year warranty from the date of original purchase. Please keep your original proof of purchase or an alternate form of documentation that validates your purchase for warranty consideration.Once we receive your equipment it goes though a preliminary inspection process that is done by one of our technicians. Once this process is completed, we register your equipment in our system and we send you a notification to the email address provided and a physical letter to the mailing address provided. This email and letter will include the list of accessories we received along with the product, it also includes information stating if your repair will be covered under your one year warranty or whether an estimate will have to approved in order to complete the repair. Repairs generally take 7-10 business days to complete as long as all parts necessary for the repair are available. Next the product will undergo a quality check that can take a couple of days then it will be shipped back to you via UPS.If your warranty has expired or the warranty was voided and you’d like to inquire about repair pricing, the online service page provides initial estimates based upon your description of the problem with your equipment. This price is an estimate and is subject to change. The price does not reflect the shipping cost and taxes as required by local, state and federal governments or applicable discounts.We apologize for the inconvenience and will do everything we can to repair your Nikon camera as quickly as possible. After sending your product into service, we will mail your service order number after your product has been logged into our system.Repair information:[...]Please click on the link above with Nikons contact information, if you have any further question.Sincerely,ChristineNikon Technical Support======Sending it back to Nikon for "evaluation" sounds like a hassle. At this point I am giving up (too easilly?) and just purchased a replacement battery. But clearly I am disappointed that a 250$ camera doesn't come with some kind of guarantee for the battery.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: FACTS MAY AT TIMES BE FRUSTRATING
Reviews.Content: I already Nikon Coolpix  s 6500 12 x wide fullHD. With wi fi.But s9500 is a miracle. If you like travelling, taking a lot of photos then forget where you had taken them, then this is the camera you need. Thanks to the GPS feature, you keep track of your own trip with date and time.If you are planning to purchase a camera, go for it. You wont regret!

Reviews.Title: The Legend Continues
Reviews.Author: Joseph Albanese "The Joe Show"
Reviews.Content: With 18 megapixels and a 22 x zoom lens, the Coolpix S9500 is another winner in Nikon's line of digital cameras.As with earlier models, the S9500 is sleek and thin, it can easily slip into your pocket or the smallest of bags without causing clutter, but only the size is small - the rest of the camera is legendary.Easy to use (Point and Shoot mode or a phlanx of shooting options), you don't know where to start when looking at Nikon's latest Coolpix.  The 18.1 mp's are quite impressive and the shooting results are nothing less than extraordinary.  The CMOS allows shooting in very dim light without any loss in end product results.  And, of course, the camera still maintains the hallmark excellence of the Nikkor lens - probably one of the finest lens that is on the market today.But Nikon has not rested on just those remarkable laurels - they've moved with the times (as always) so the S9500 has a relatively easy WiFi function.  Coupled with a free app (I am using an iPad where the app is called NIKON WMU (wireless mobile utility)), you can immediately transfer your photos from the S9500 to a tablet, your phone or computer.  No wires or patching required before you are posting your beautiful photos onto Facebook or any other social network!There is also a built-in GSP that I am still toying with - living in New York City it is active but has not found (or can't find because of the buildings) a satellite signal.  But that doesn't take anything away from the ease of use, fantastic photos and sturdy construction of the S9500.

Reviews.Title: Pocket camera takes great pictures with many built-in features
Reviews.Author: Ivan Pedruzzi
Reviews.Content: The Nikon S9500 takes excellent high resolution pictures and movies in a considerable small package. With a battery charge you can go on a full day. I was positively impressed by the low light video capturing: we recorded the fireworks at DisneyWorld at midnight which resulted in clear clip with natural colors.The GPS tagging is very convenient. While the wireless transfer sound cool in theory is not practical, unless you are using google cloud, in which case makes it easy to sync your pictures with your IPad or IPhone.The plastic door which closes over the lenses when the camera shuts down fails to close occasionally, the behavior appears to be random. When it happens, clicking on and off again makes the door close properly.

Reviews.Title: Battery Will Not Charge, Camera Will Not Turn On
Reviews.Author: S. Busby
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a week ago, but not through Amazon.  I followed all the instructions for preparing the camera and it indicated that the battery was fully charged.  I took a few pictures the day I got it and stored it for the remainder of the week.  When I got it out yesterday, the battery was low (even though I had not been using the camera).  I took 2-3 pictures and the battery was exhausted and the camera shut off.  I tried to charge the battery for a few hours.  The manual says there should be a green light flashing while charging.  I saw it blink a few times, then quit.  When the time came that it should have been fully charged, I tried to turn on the camera, it came on only for a split second and has never turned on since then.  According to my voltmeter, the 3.7v battery has 2.6 volts on it, which should be enough to at least get the camera to turn on with a low battery indication.With what few pictures I got, I was not impressed with the results of indoor pictures using the flash.  This may be due in part to me not having enough time to get familiar with the different settings, though.At this point, I'm not sure if the problem is with the battery, the charger, the charger cord, or the camera itself.  All I know is I've had it one week and it won't work.

Reviews.Title: Tiny package with grand features
Reviews.Author: Darbys Mom
Reviews.Content: bought this for travel.  So small it is easy to tote.  Love the GPS - can see where we were on vacation!  and I replaced another brand camera -  The batteries last on this camera I was prepared to change frequently and I did not have to.  Beautiful photos and great zoom  I am over the top happy.

Reviews.Title: Odd focusing in low light
Reviews.Author: Donna Visocan
Reviews.Content: I've owned several Nikon Coolpix cameras and wanted this one for its high zoom capability.  Unfortunately, the camera's inability to focus on things in low light caused me to return this one.  I also did not like the pop-up flash which was located exactly where you hold the camera.  This camera might be suitable for someone who wants to adjust settings, but if you are looking for a true point and shoot that auto focuses quickly, this is not the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera - Not Working
Reviews.Author: Tim Rathbun
Reviews.Content: After charging the battery I found the outer shutter would not open or not fully open. This is potentialy a very nice camera however the one I recieved was defective. Thanks to Amazon I was able to return the camera for a complete refund.

Reviews.Title: Battery wouldn't charge out of box
Reviews.Author: Susan Denny
Reviews.Content: The Nikon S9500's wide angle and premium zoom were excellent features that worked well. I had the camera for one day when the battery, after a couple dozen shots needed to be recharged.  It charged for several hours but the error message was only ever "battery exhausted."  I was exhausted trying to get it to charge.  This camera seemed to have a lot of potential but didn't want the headache of dealing with something that didn't work well right out of the box so I took it back.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Ronald W. Dvorsky Jr.
Reviews.Content: Easier to use than my full size digital SLR camera.  Small enough to put in pocket.  WiFi enabled to see photos/edit on iPad or iPhone without having to go home to upload and post on social media using Nikon App. Sync's with GPS without wait before taking photos.  Great photo quality.Cons:  None at this timeWould recommend to friends and family

Reviews.Title: best compact camera
Reviews.Author: kk
Reviews.Content: S9500 is easy to use with multiple image and video shooting modes. We were looking for a camera which has minimal manual settings and still clicks best shots. Coolpix s9500 is surely among them.It provides best shots in outdoor,  even in bright sunlight. Different modes like panorama, sports, night, food , macro r good. 22x zoom is is stunning. I can get well focused images even at full zoom. Face focus and manual focus works well. I am yet to test it indoor low light/party mode.I liked smart mode feature the most. Alaid I tested Wi-Fi in this s9500 and it works superb. U can view and take pictures wireless. Some people had problems with Wi-Fi bit I m able to do it.Cons: sometimes camera throws weird sound in few modes which one may not b able to hear since it it's v low. Also pop-up flash is at incorrect position, u always keep ur finger on it while clicking the snap.Update 09/06/2013I took Coolpix S9500 camera to my summer holidays and very happy with that. I was able to take more than 300 shots in 1 day with the battery still showing more than 50%. (GPS and WIFI off, No videos). Never ran out of battery issue.It takes 2-3 seconds to focus when u r using full zoom but that was fine with me. But the quality of zoom photos was fantastic, no complaints.Also low light shots are clear especially images captured in museums r good.Initially I have to try different modes/flash on-off to get correct image quality. But imagas r good at the end. Biggest con of this camera i noticed is the placement of pop-up flash, which is disturbing while taking images as I mentioned earlier.Overall , I found this camera best in its category for outdoor and low light shots. Great work by Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Faithful husband
Reviews.Content: My wife comments "boy does this take great pictures!!".  The options work great, like close up, zoom, panorama etc.  The only draw back is the location of the flash, It is where you put a finger to hold it.

Reviews.Title: Will not charge any kind of battery. Even a Nikon battery.
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: I have always been very happy with Nikon products. I was very disappointed as soon as I try to use the camera. I have purchased a lot of accessories and extra batteries to go with the camera however the original battery would not charge. I tried other batteries in the camera and they also would not charge. The manual says you should have a slow green blinking light while it's charging mine would not even do that. I'm not looking forward to shipping this back and going through all that hassle.

Reviews.Title: Works for me.
Reviews.Author: James Skinner
Reviews.Content: The camera I had previous to this one used film, so I'm obviously no great judge of cameras. Having said that, the Nikon s9500 has exceeded my expectations. I've owned it for several months, more than enough time to expose any manufacturing defects. I've had no problems. The zoom, one of the main reasons I bought it, allows me get the shots I need. I take mainly outdoor photos, and in my opinion it works great in low light. I never use the flash, have it disabled.As for the setup, I had it up and running in a matter of minutes. Not much information in the quick start guide, but even for a beginner its easy. My only complaint is about the wifi. You would think they would include a few setup instructions for it and the mobile app you need. Nothing that I could find. I had to go to YouTube to figure it out, but once I saw the video it was easy. As for how the wifi works I've had zero problems transferring pictures to my phone. A minor complaint, and one I don't understand, is why edited images will not transfer over wifi.As for video it looks beautiful on the camera and my computer, however it doesn't look as good when uploading it to Facebook, again I don't know why. Maybe someone else can answer that.My final conclusion is this is a great little camera. A few minor complaints aside, I'm very happy with it.Update: I mentioned in my review that videos uploaded directly to Facebook did not look as good as they did on the camera or my computer. I found out If you upload the videos to YouTube and then from YouTube to Facebook they look great. Problem solved.

Reviews.Title: Very misleading product description- can not transfer pics directly to FB
Reviews.Author: Robert Bacsik
Reviews.Content: "Shoot a stunning panorama landscape, then instantly share it - along with the exact location it was shot" False advertising- extremely misleading!We just received this camera in the mail and are returning it on Monday. We purchased this camera after reading great reviews, and going over the manufacturers product description and specs many times. We were under the impression that like they state above, that we would instantly be able to share our pictures. Nowhere (not even in the manufacturers guide that comes with the camera) does it say that you need to download an app onto your smart phone and then sinc the camera to your device, then upload your pictures, and then you are finally able to "instantly share" your pictures. At first we thought that we were doing something wrong, but after several hours of searching, I finally found an honest review on a photography website that described the camera as "a great smartphone accessory". We did not pay several hundred dollars for a Smartphone accessory. Not as convenient as we thought, and we are very disappointed in the blatant false advertising by Nikon.Besides this function (which was the sole reason we bought this camera), the camera works fine and is very light weight and well designed. We will return it and wait until their competitor finishes their unfinished design and actually comes out with a finished product that can actually "instantly share" photos online.

Reviews.Title: Took it to spain and got lovely pictures
Reviews.Author: Bhroam Mann
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my trip to spain.  I came home with amazing pictures.  I was able to zoom to frame my pictures perfectly.  Several of the cathedrals had a no-flash policy.  The camera was up to the task.  I took plenty of inside pictures.  I even turned the flash off in some buildings when I could have used it since it did such a good job.The only real con is that the GPS can't get a signal inside.  Outside it locks on really quickly.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9500 works for me!
Reviews.Author: 1080p fan
Reviews.Content: Hello,We just returned from a 2 week European trip using the Nikon S9500.The Nikon S9500 (primary camera) was awesome with GPS, other nice features, and the 4.5mm-99mm zoom got me right in there when the shot required it. The GPS data were awesome to remind us where we were when reviewing photos. No more taking photos of street signs.For about $100 more than the Nikon S6500 (my smaller backup camera, no GPS, that I returned after the trip), I recommend the slightly larger and a bit heavier Nikon S9500 instead. Buy a separate charger and at least 1 extra battery if you plan shoot more than 200 photos per day. Use the wrist strap (saved me twice), and don't drop it!  Costco has a nice kit that includes a belt case and 16GB SD card.Couldn't get the Wi-Fi to move photos to my PC or phone, but I simply removed the SD card and uploaded the photos and video to my notebook PC daily.  Now that I have more time, I can figure it out for the next trip.Hope this helps.John

Reviews.Title: camera defective
Reviews.Author: bill caldwell
Reviews.Content: original camera did not operate......replacement camera did not operate both returned to vendor. Contacted Nikon who could not correct the problem

Reviews.Title: Camera ran hot.
Reviews.Author: Penny Schritz
Reviews.Content: Not good.kept running hot, and would turn off after taking 4or 5 pictures or looking at pictures. Sorry I had to send back. I will wait awhile before I buy another.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: This was purchased for our 13 year old grandson. We selected this particular model from the many available primarily because of the size of the zoom and also that it has a rechargeable battery. Although some reviews seem to favor regular AA's, we know the amount of disposables would be hefty. I purchased an additional battery and separate charger so that he always has enough for extended use. This camera has all the bells and whistles you could need but the best thing is the quality of the pictures, which are excellent for a camera this size and price range.

Reviews.Title: broke after a month - never really worked that well
Reviews.Author: Jordan
Reviews.Content: I have an older version and thought it was time for an upgrade.  I should have followed the rule of if aint broke don't fix it.  Anyway after two weeks the battery would not charge so had to return it.

Reviews.Title: Horrible battery life. Took great pictures for 4 months
Reviews.Author: Ted G.
Reviews.Content: Bought camera in July, 2013. Only charged the battery 3 or 4 times and when I tried to use the camera this week it said battery depleted and won't charge at all now.  Nikon said I ave to send everything in for technicians to troubleshoot.  Won't send a replacement battery otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Keeps shutting itself off
Reviews.Author: Edward D. Webster
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in June 2013Began having problems shortly after. It kept shutting itself down with lens open. Had to pull out battery and put back in to get it to work. Over and over and over.My store replaced it with another one (S9500) and now it has the same problem. Plus the zoom has a way of taking off and zooming all the way in after I stop pushing the button.Pictures are good, but you miss a lot of pictures taking the battery out and waiting for it to re-boot.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as expected
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Lot's of technology in this.  Case seems cheaply made, to cut on costs.  Do not like the pop up flash (preferred the built in of my old Lumix), particularly as it pops up right where I usually put my left index finger.  Standard pictures are generally good.  But the flash, at shorter ranges, frequently leaves the picture over exposed.  Have had some issues with focus and sharpness, beyond what would be normally expected, on higher zoom shots.  Got a good price on this camera, but would not buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in nikon.
Reviews.Author: Bill Nelson
Reviews.Content: Focus issues made this camera a real disappointment and after years of using nikons finally pushed me over to canon. Amazon deserves five stars for making the return easy even under some unusual circumstances. But the camera shoots soft under all conditions. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: Very cool camera!
Reviews.Author: Barry
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon 3100, but I hate lugging it around.  This is exactly what I was looking for.  I wanted high definition as well as a strong zoom.  22X...... Boo-yah!  I had read that some folks could hear the motor focusing while they were taking videos.  I haven't noticed that concern so far.  Very happy with this dandy little camera.  My son asked for my opinion on a camera.  He also bought this camera, and is also very happy with it's diversity.  He lives in the Rockies and has kids, so has multiple opportunities to use the various capabilities of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sheri H Friedrich
Reviews.Content: It's perfect! It's everything I wanted in a compact camera. It takes great pictures, including action shots. I brought it to a Red Sox game and the people behind me couldn't believe how clear the shots were. Looking forward to taking lots of pictures of my new grandbaby with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Jefferson "Willieboy"
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the best compact camera I've ever owned.  Superior features and quality as well as great zoom length.  Especially easy to learn all the most important features and use of all it's capabilities.  The only improvement I could see for this camera would be to somehow have the flash built into the front of the camera instead of popping up from the top left side.  It's a small new habit one has to form to make certain your hands are not holding the camera at the top left side so that the flash can pop up properly when needed but by no means is this a major issue as the camera has so many easy to understand and use features enabling the owner to take superb pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MattyBoy717
Reviews.Content: Well, for me, this camera is as close to having a full size SDLR as I could get on my budget. It takes great photos and the 1080p video looks beautiful. Lots of different options for individually creative shots. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: WI-Fi does not work
Reviews.Author: Reynaldo
Reviews.Content: great pictures, but case is cheap plastic and Wi-Fi does not work, I would look for a different brand, not worth the money

Reviews.Title: Must have got a lemon :-(
Reviews.Author: D. Gehlsen "Nikon Shooter"
Reviews.Content: Pretty disappointed with Nikon, first Nikon that I have had problems with. Love the design, much better then the Sony HX30. The P9500 has large buttons, snappy operation and quick GPS position acquisition which are important to me as as a real estate appraiser. First outing got a "lens error" where the lens got stuck extending and a lockup. Had to manually push the lens in to get it unstuck and I was getting camera lockups. The camera would freeze, the live view would still be working , but it would not focus, zoom, or take a picture and would require the battery be removed to reset it. After a while it would freeze after 10 or 15 images. Pretty disappointed that it was going on but not sure if its a lemon or something wrong with the camera in general. Sending it back and trying out the Nikon P330, hopefully will have better luck with that one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - better WiFi Service Needed
Reviews.Author: David J. Martin "Opera Lover"
Reviews.Content: This is our second Nikon Coolpix. We loved the first and used it well all over the world. We wanted a new camera that was just as good, but with WiFi and GPS.  We were happy to see Nikon had added these features.  To start with, the camera takes great pix as did its predecessor. Good in low light and great for zoom.  Small enough to fit in a suit or jacket pocket so we could take it to dinners and theater when we didn't want our big camera around.  The GPS works quite nicely although they indicate you have to turn it off manually as it continues to run even when the camera is off, using up battery.  You would think they could do this automatically.  With the WiFi service it does shut off when the camera is turned off.  You download free software for your phone/iPad and it connects to the camera.  This works just fine, but it's not what I thought we were getting.  We were hoping it connected via WiFi directly to the internet and could upload our pix either to the cloud or select photos directly to Facebook, etc.  The new Samsung Galaxy cameras do this.  This really is just a transfer utility moving pix from the camera to your phone or iPad via WiFi.  From there you can upload them the usual way. And it uses WiFi for this near-field type communication instead of Bluetooth. I'm not sure why as an application of this type could easily be done by Bluetooth.  When the iPad/Phone connects to the camera via WiFi your internet connection via WiFi is terminated. Once you disconnect the camera you then need to reconnect your Internet WiFi. While this is a step in the right direction for Nikon, it's not far enough to compete with Samsung in this regard. They need a better software solution for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S9500 works great
Reviews.Author: Daniel Hier
Reviews.Content: I love the wireless feature that allows me to download pictures to my iPhone without a wireless network--Camera creates its own hotspot.  Pictures are of high quality.  Camera is easy to use. Compact and easy to carry in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Tom M.
Reviews.Content: Let's get the good out of the way: The pictures look great for a point and shoot, different modes available for shooting, and it's awesome in low light. I don't think I ever used the flash.Now, the bad. It freezes. The power button doesn't always turn the camera on. If there's too much motion, it will refuse to take the picture. Or, it just won't take a picture anyway. I missed a lot of candid shots because of these issues. When you're taking videos and zoom, the motor is slightly audible. If you have the full-time motion control on during a video, it's constantly clicking which you can hear in the videos.I went through three of these in a row. The first, after a day or two, already had dust in the lens enclosure (why I sold my previous camera, a Panasonic ZS7). The second had hardware problems; the flash didn't feel solid as it sort of 'squished' back into the case and didn't always lock. The third I had for a while on a vacation, and the aforementioned problems happened (freezing, crashing, etc). I'm taking this back and maybe trying out the SX280. GPS is a feature I really like and that narrows my options down severely.It seems like all of these problems could be resolved with a firmware flash, but it doesn't seem that Nikon wants to address it so I'll be returning camera number three (the first already had a speck of dust in the enclosure, and with the second, the flash mechanism didn't lock back in place).

Reviews.Title: Image quality great, audio needs a redesign
Reviews.Author: Mandy
Reviews.Content: I recently got this camera for a concert I was attending (Mumford and Sons). I wanted to have a camera with a good zoom so I could get close-ups. Wow, you can't even imagine how close this camera gets.  I ended up being front row, and didn't really need the zoom, but when it was used, clarity is amazing. It did take me a while to figure out what setting worked best, and I do think I could he gotten a lot more shots if it fired faster.  Also, when the band ws moving, forget it - all shots were blurry.  When the flash pops up, it is awkward, and kind of cheap feeling.  I don't really like to use flash, but when it popped up, I always felt like it would break off the camera.  I used the 3D photo option, but honestly think this is a stupid feature, unless when i put on 3D glasses the photos are amazing. Currently they just look like a double image. The video clarity when you playback on the camera, or computer is incredible as well, but when transferred to a site like YouTube, even when in HD, the quality diminishes.The most MAJOR COMPLAINT I have is the microphone.  Completely awful design and poor ability to pick up sound.  The microphone is on the left side of the camera, and it is just two small openings.  The quality didn't turn out awful, you can hear the band, but it is so close to me, that my voice is just too loud.  I want to go to a show to sing my heart out, but not actually have to listen to it.  I feel like a large portion of my videos are ruined because of this. I never had this problem with my old nikon, the mic was on the bottom.  It should really be in the front, we when you film you're tying to pick up external sounds, not your own speaking.  This has such great video capabilities, I just found the poor audio outweighs them.  Here is a link to a video recorded with it, you can hear what I'm talking about.  Please excuse my terrible voice, I did not know it was being recorded :)http://m.youtube.com/watch?feature=plcp&v;=Vl9BVFOb3kg

Reviews.Title: Worked great for 3 months and then died
Reviews.Author: Leonard Inkster
Reviews.Content: This is a handy camera.  Size, functions, operation and speed at which the pictures are saved are all great, but all of a sudden the camera died.  Won't charge, won't turn on, won't close.  Tried a new batter, nothing.  Warranty sucks so I guess it's off to buy a new camera.  Won't be replacing it with a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: No Complaints
Reviews.Author: Red Wings "G"
Reviews.Content: I liked the product that I purchased.  No complaints with it.  It met my expectations.  I would endorse it to others

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9500
Reviews.Author: Michael Lovatt "Michael Lovatt"
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera. Doesn't look like it but the color is rough and easy to grip, we were expecting a slick anodized body that slipped out of our hands but it grips nicely.  The Wi-Fi is kind of hokey, it downloads slowly with my iphone 5 but it is a nice little feature if you don't mind a few minutes to set it up each time to take selfies or to wait for that perfect shot.  Lots of built in features including exposure adjustment to help lighten up darker shots.

Reviews.Title: What Happened?
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: The camera started out great but stopped working after 3 months. In fact I should check on getting a refund.....

Reviews.Title: S9500 is REally Nice!
Reviews.Author: Arrow Flight
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I am a semi-professional photographer, and this camera is my go to when I dont want to carry my large SLR Nikon.  This takes really nice low light pictures without flash even with an F3.4 lens. ISO up to 3200, macro mode, 16 scene modes, adjustable white balance, GPS, WI fi compatable ( to send to other device) and selectable 99 focus points>  If you are pretty familiar with camera operations, you should enjoy this camera.  If new to photography, this camera is still suitable, if you take the time to read the manual, or just put it on auto mode and shoot.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: BO
Reviews.Content: I have several Nikon cameras including a small S630 & a large SLR I wanted something as small as the 630 with more functions & better zoom. The 9500 fills my need perfectly. The one I purchased is refurbished but looks & functions like new. I couldn't be more pleased

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix s9500 wi-fi digital camera
Reviews.Author: Sue Markowski
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera:) It has met and surpassed all my expectations I wanted in a digital camera.  I still have to learn more about its features and look forward to doing so. I am so happy my friend suggested this camera to me.  She bought one and used it on a vacation cruise in New Zealand and was very pleased with it. I love the zoom feature the most so far.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot and Light Weight
Reviews.Author: Shopper4life
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with this purchase, I also own a Nikon D7000 and it is way too much at times to lug around when I just need to take quick pictures.  I am in real estate and need to include date and time stamps on my photos and this model does exactly what I need it to do.  It makes my life so much simpler.  My huge deluxe Nikon doesn't allow the functionality of date and time stamps and what a bummer because that camera cost over $1000.  The camera takes great pictures, excellent and the flash is super.  There is a slightly longer delay between shots which is frustrating for me right now since I have been taking pictures in the freezing cold.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Colorado Cruiser
Reviews.Content: My workhorse camera is a Canon dslr with a couple of nice lenses but there are times that I don't want to haul around the big camera bag.Canon doesn't have a handheld comparable to this Nikon, and I'm very happy with the pic quality.  The optical zoom is amazing, I was able to get a close up of a face on stage from the opposite corner of a high school theater.You can't go wrong with this camera.  The only drawback is that the charger is fairly large considering it's just a USB plug.

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera
Reviews.Author: Kokopelli "Kokopelli"
Reviews.Content: Great photos from an easy to use camera at a reasonable price. My lady loves her Christmas present. Buy it

Reviews.Title: Great iPad/iPhone app as well!
Reviews.Author: Matt Perky
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this camera in all areas mentioned in other reviews. One thing I haven't seen mentioned is that there is a Nikon app for iPad and iPhone that syncs up with the camera (its called "Nikon Wireless Mobile Utility"). It's really easy to use once you have it set up. Basically you can view and save all your photos on your iPad via wireless network. This app makes it unnecessary to remove your SD card from your camera, The days of dragging and dropping files are over!

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: David Lee
Reviews.Content: Excellent all around camera, except flash pops up where my left hand finger placement is used to hold the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S9500 Wi-Fi Digital Camera with 22x Zoom and GPS
Reviews.Author: Amr Arafat
Reviews.Content: - Super zoom- size is suitable- must have memory card for storage- quality of videos are great- easily adjusted settings- I recommend for non professionals photographers

Reviews.Title: Why did I choose this rating?
Reviews.Author: DIana Gutta
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased the Nikon CoolPix S9500 for a gift. First the service was excellent and on time tracking was great.Secondly, this the third Nikon camera that I have purchased and the quality is really unbelievable. Took pictures the other night of the Empire State Building and the colors were just spectacular.  Love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Who tested the pop up flash?
Reviews.Author: Robert Gustin
Reviews.Content: I did read the reviews on how the flash was right where you hold the camera, but being a lefty, I figured it wouldn't effect me all that much given the other great features of this camera. NOT!Almost every time the flash pops up ( probably the last 15 or 20 times) my left finger is right over the flash. Fact is the normal way you hold a point and shoot will interfere with this flash pop up.I love the available settings.One final comment, when deleting photos you must take great care not to click one too many times or you can select a delete of all your photos. Nikon should have not allowed scrolling that loops.If it wasn't for the flash location, I'd rate this camera a 4.3

Reviews.Title: Will have to return
Reviews.Author: zeusqueen62
Reviews.Content: Immediately the lens cover didn't open and I had issues with camera on my entire trip to France.  It is so disappointing because I bought it just so I could have great pictures on my trip.

Reviews.Title: Good value.
Reviews.Author: BornInVA
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to always get sharp pictures. If you want very high-level quality photos you will need to post process the photos in an editing app, like Photoshop. But, for mediocre shots, this is a great camera. Just do not expect this camera to take the same quality photos of a much higher end camera.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures with outstanding zoom in a tiny thing
Reviews.Author: Flori
Reviews.Content: I received my camera (in Red) yesterday and I like the convenience of its size. This only reason I rated 4 stars instead of 5 is because the WiFi feature totally sucks. The camera is either "negociating" forever with my iPad mini, either looses connection after a very short period of time (about 2 minutes) and to connect again, it is quite frustrating. So, I will completely forget this feature and use traditional backup to view and save pictures/videos on computers. Other than that, no problem. I use this "tiny" camera as a spare one along with my other professional Nikon and to carry everywhere I go. Pictures are great and of course, zoom is outstanding for a little thing! It is what I love the most in this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Point and Shoot!
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pictures.  This easily beats my two previous Sony cameras of similar size.  The pictures are more focused and the color is amazing. Great point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Louis H Otos
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for 6 months and have had to send the camera in 3 times for repairs.  The camera is extremely fragile.  I expected more from Nikon.  Nikon service center was reluctant to repair the camera under warranty and most recently, sent the camera back after repairing the flash that broke and the camera would not turn on requiring me to again return the camera for repair.  The camera is loaded with features but those are useless if the camera doesn't work.  The reader may notice that the camera originally sold for $350 but is now being sold for $275.  Nikon is recognizing their engineering mistake.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ruisdael L. Vallejo "RLV"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to upgrade my old cyber shot. The camera is amazing, has great colors, resolution, size, and zoom. I am very please with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Decent, but lacking
Reviews.Author: Steven H. Douglas
Reviews.Content: Right off the bat you can tell this is a pretty nice camera. But then again I only had 4 year old cameras to compare it to.So when we finally got to test it outside of a store we found its limitations. Compared to our 4 year old Panasonic Lumix, which has its own problems, it didn't match up.This camera's macro isn't really macro, its auto focus on zoomed in objects is terrible, the colors are under-saturated, and there are absolute zero manual options.If you're not going to include manual options, then a camera coming out now should be good enough to take colorful sharp pictures. Compared to the competition, this camera is lacking.

Reviews.Title: Excellant , easy to use.....
Reviews.Author: Ronald Talmage
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth Coolpix and I wasn't disappointed. I like a small quality camera to carry in my pocket when I'm using my old trusted d-5000 Nikon...........

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix s9500
Reviews.Author: papi
Reviews.Content: always been a Nikon man needed some thing small to travel with and this was the best love it should have thougth about this before

Reviews.Title: a good buy
Reviews.Author: Ronnie K
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this camera. What a zoom! For my casual use I got the best camera for me. the pictures are hi def and so clear.

Reviews.Title: Cool, new gadgets
Reviews.Author: Lisa A. Wohl
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Nikon Coolpix 8000; what a difference! I am so happy that I purchased this product! It has many of the "bells and whistles" of much larger cameras!

Reviews.Title: Takes very nice photos!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so that I would have a small digital camera for traveling (I normally use a Nikon D7100 DSLR). I have been particularly pleased with how fast it focuses. The thing I like the least about the camera is how the flash pops up...it seems like it could easily break. I am careful with it though, so hopefully that won't happen. I have only had this camera about a month, so far I really like it!

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: jim streuber
Reviews.Content: Love this camera has the bell & whistles anybody should ever need. Smaller size but takes excellent pictures. Great for people who do not want to carry around a large camera.

Reviews.Title: new camera
Reviews.Author: ANNE BLACKWELL COLLINS
Reviews.Content: i had the previous model which i just wasnt happy with so reverted to the model before that, then met a fellow traveler who had been given this by friends and loved it - i saw her pictures and decided i needed to get this.......and i am very happy with it - gave my other one to my sister. Would highly recommend it for good quality point-and-shoot with great zoomABC, Boonton, NJ

Reviews.Title: Does not have some of the features of earlier models.
Reviews.Author: LAWRENCE B. MOSS
Reviews.Content: It does not have the continuous picture feature that is on the S9300.  I am going to try it again a few times and may then return it to you for reimbursement.

Reviews.Title: Quality in a compact point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Bob F
Reviews.Content: Great pics and easy to use.  Compact size, 22x zoom and quality digital images make this camera a must.  Often use this camera over my D300 with 18-300 lens for travel/ vacation photos.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera !
Reviews.Author: Sudeep Chavare
Reviews.Content: Its an awesome camera for the price . It captures crisp colors and snap quality is very nice for beginners like me .. I am yet to explore the GPS and WiFi fearures but I am already loving this ! Absolutely resommended !!!

Reviews.Title: Failed after 3 weeks
Reviews.Author: Tom Nielsen
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks the camera started to frees-up and the only way to get it to restart was to remove and reinsert the battery. This is my 5th Nikon  and 3 have failed. the first an S630 still works but the card will not lock in place. the 2nd an S8200 failed to focus after a years use. I would not recommend Nikon point and shoot cameras. This said my D7000 DSLR is excellent and has not disappointed me.I am looking for recommendations for a new point and shoot camera with good features for travel.

Reviews.Title: Great New Camera With A Lot Of Options And Fairly Reasonable Price!
Reviews.Author: Alloveramp
Reviews.Content: I bought this one for the Zoom feature, the small size all self contained wi Fi and GPS and the 18.1 MPS count. It filled in a gap that I wanted to fill. To compare it with my 2011 Canon Power Shot IS 3300 A, I would say that it gives a richer picture. It has much more zoom capability. It also shoots in 1080 P. So all and all it is a big step up from my 100$ Canon which is what I was looking for. I also have a Nikon Coolpix AW-100 and that is good for certain environments but this one has the wi Fi which I like and much more zoom of course. So all and all it is a very sophisticated point and shoot camera and a good buy for what it is and what it does.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "SargD"
