} } } Length:: 0:34 MinsThe pictures are crisp and clear, zoom is wonderful, videos are outstanding. Very easy to use. No problems with the operation, until you get to the playback. Every time I try to play back, or review pictures or video it will freeze up at some point and you have to remove the battery and put it back in. You lose nothing, but it is a pain in the a--! I have not contacted Amazon or Nikon yet as I am still on vacation, and my pic's and videos of Alaska are breathtaking. Even with this glitch, this is a wonderful camera. 5 stars + without the freezing problem.UPDATE:The freezing issue is now only on one video, why I don't know, but it is no longer an issue. I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Brigitte Wiss
Reviews.Content: I love the zoom. Powerful and give detailed pictures.The camera is great and compact. I haven't tried yet the GPS function.

Reviews.Title: Terrible battery life!
Reviews.Author: helpful but picky consumer
Reviews.Content: I have been searching for a digital camera to replace my old broken Canon... Thought Nikon made quality cameras- they are a little famous for it! I was incredibly disappointed when I saw that the battery gets charged inside the camera...initially not a big deal, except that my charger was most likely faulty, so camera went from "full battery icon" to "low battery", &powered; off halfway through my cousins wedding after letting it charge all day...this was after I had disabled the GBS & other battery draining features in preparation for the event...also, the camera is awkward to hold ( kind of heavy) and pricey for not being a higher model/ more features...after checking out the indoor evening wedding pictures in print, I determined to return this camera: nifty wifi upload does not outweigh poor low light picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Carla Rye Faherty
Reviews.Content: Takes great pix and can send wirelessly to phone, computer or iPad.  Pictures are beautiful.  Love the bright red color.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Jake-oy
Reviews.Content: The camera is excellent but just a tad bigger than I really wanted.I need to add 7 more words in order to post this so this should cover it.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed.
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I was hoping for a simple to use point and shoot camera with WiFi. What I got for my $300 was a cool WiFi camera that takes marginal photos at best. I have an old clunker from Olympus that takes comparable quality photographs. The Auto setting seems useless. The flash is a very poor design that I expect will give me issues down the road. Halfway through my vacation to the great state of Washington, I put this little thing away and broke out my Samsung Galaxy S3. I took about 500 photographs, of which less than 10 were even worthy of keeping. Sadly, I also purchased spare batteries and an external charger for this. I guess I will have to salvage it somehow. I just don't think you can take quality photographs with this camera without tweaking the settings. I wanted something that was much easier to operate.

Reviews.Title: disappointed unfortunately
Reviews.Author: Jean Futoran
Reviews.Content: used this product for 3 weeks, liked it for quick picture taking after pressing the button, occasionally very good focusdislike it for long recovery time between the pictures and for inconsistent focus - lots of pictures get too dark and/or blurryalso the flash that comes out of a camera is a bit inconvenience, especially if stranger takes your picture and covers it with his handbattery life was shorter than I was used too. Was not enough for 1 day of travel.

Reviews.Title: Europe trip
Reviews.Author: The Critic
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to Europe for 18 days. Took 5000 pictures and 18 GB of data. Some issues with lens errors when putting the camera in a pocket and it opening spontaneous. Picture quality was spectacular. Panorama view were easy to use and good. Used 3 batteries a day with heavy use but otherwise power was stable. Bought it for wifi transfer to post from IPhone to Facebook because I didn't want to take a laptop - worked perfectly. Only knock was the lens issue and will see if it persists at home.

Reviews.Title: Loved this camera to start with....sigh
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Got this camera as a christmas gift. I am a casual camera user, a few shots every couple days of the dogs....not a hundred pics of everything under the sun...so just your average user.Quality of pictures and film, very good for the price.However, item breaks way to easily. I didn't even drop it or shake it or anything.Had some kind of error happen and caused the battery to insist it was full, then suddenly die. Then once it did that and I recharged the battery, the lens zoomed in and out repeatedly and refused to take pictures.Website informs me I need to ship it to them (wherever they are)and it will cost 125 dollars to repair. As it was a gift, of course I don't have the warranty information. I'm not spending over a hundred dollars to repair a camera that is only 5 months old.Very unhappy that you can not take it anyplace local, it must be shipped back to the manufacturer. Expensive paperweight.

Reviews.Title: great size
Reviews.Author: russel g watson
Reviews.Content: excellent small sized camera , Great zoom (22), Great pixels (18). Lots of optional features and settings. Will be my travel camera for sure

Reviews.Title: The dealer tried their best
Reviews.Author: Mary-Jo Y.
Reviews.Content: The item is 5 stars and I purchased it because I had a similar camera previously.  What was the issue was that no tracking information was issued (as I generally expect from other Amazon purchases) and when the expected delivery date passed, I contacted the seller.  They said the contacted the shipper and was told it was lost and would resend another one. They did, but not until about a week after that and a couple more e-mails.  Tracking information should be readily available and the customer should not have to go investigating through layers of information.  I work for an Amazon seller and process the orders so I know what should be expected and am disappointed that tracking was such an issue.  I know things "get lost" and it is usually the shippers fault; although the shipper will automatically say it is the sellers fault.  How that is possible is beyond common sense.  I don't blame the seller for sending it out with expectations that it would be delivered to the address provided.  If they has processed the replacement when they said they would, they would have received a 5 as they wanted.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Ramshaw
Reviews.Content: I have an older Nikon Coolpix so I am sold on Nikon. This newest model far surpasses my old one, but I won't let it go of it, as it still gives me good photos. The features of this S9500 make it so easy to take any photo any time of day or night and you can clean up the pic easier. It is amazing.

Reviews.Title: HATE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Renee Cook
Reviews.Content: I can never get this camera to focus.  I take 20 pictures to get one that is in focus!!  Hate it!!

Reviews.Title: Shutter sticks
Reviews.Author: James A. Mulvany
Reviews.Content: I bought this Nikon because I liked my last one.  However, the shutter would not open on my old one, so I replaced it with this one.  Now, I have used the new Coolpix for one vacation, and the shutter is sticking on this one.  I have had it less than 2 months and I am going to Peru in a couple weeks.  I'm not happy to say the least.

Reviews.Title: Really great camera.
Reviews.Author: Richard Muniz
Reviews.Content: For a quick shot camera, it takes really good pictures.  It isn't very big so it is easy to carry.  The 22x zoom comes in really handy to get close shots.  The macro mode isn't bad either.

Reviews.Title: Think about another brand
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace my 3rd of 4th in a row Sony pocket camera. Boy am I sorry. The camera *might* be OK but it's a little big and clunky compared to competitors. Just don't need to get it fixed by Nikon. Lens cover failed out of the box and I've been trying to get it fixed for a couple of months. Sent it back to them, on my dime, and after a 2-3 week interval got it back in the same condition. Need it for an upcoming vacation, reconnected with them and am still awaiting a response. A small thing perhaps but with service like this I'd never recommend Nikon. Will update this review if they really impress me... but I'm not optimistic.

Reviews.Title: Great camera very bad wifi/connectivity
Reviews.Author: Adolfo G. Lemoine
Reviews.Content: Overall this is as expected from a nikon product. I have been using nikon cameras for over 20 years.  Pictures are very good clear and resolution is top notch.  Where this camera falls short is in the implementation of wifi. Nikon chose to go with a proprietary wifi which does not connect to regular home wifi or to a laptop. On top of this the software for connecting to an android device is practically useless.  You can't select individual pictures to transfer and if you have a memory card full of pics it insists on downloading all of them every time.  I must give the camera a good review,  but very bad review for the non camera tech.  Not a connected camera at all!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Lorraine S. Nolan
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes great pictures, tucks in my purse so I always have it with me and is a ton of fun to use.  It's perfect for an amateur picture taker like me.

Reviews.Title: Is not compatible with Samsung Galaxy S3
Reviews.Author: Barbara Holmes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly for the WiFi feature.  I wanted to be able to upload my pictures to social media sites when I take them.  I love the camera size, zoom and the pictures.  However, it states you can sync with your smartphone, but it does not tell you it will not work with all of them.  So make sure your phone is compatible before you buy it.  If I would have known this issue with the Samsung phone, I would not have purchased it in the first place.

Reviews.Title: Incredible
Reviews.Author: Bruno Marcello Rodrigues
Reviews.Content: The camera is awesome. It has a great and powerful zoom, the battery duration is enough!It is light and easy to carry

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but some quality control issues
Reviews.Author: John Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Nikon Coolpix S9500 in Dec 2013 and used it for three months.  The camera is great in terms of having a long zoom capability, ability to take pictures under a wide ranging of lighting conditions (e.g., night portrait and night landscape settings are very useful), and being able to take good video.  However, a spot developed in each picture and I realized it was not dirt on the lens.  It was internal the the lens, and would vary in diameter depending on the zoom.  These cameras are made in China, and there have been some reports of quality control problems with some of their cameras.  I have returned the defective one and will try another one - perhaps the lens spotting problem I had was a low frequency quality control problem.  Has anyone else had problems with a permanent spot showing up in their pics with this camera?

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: I love the Zoom Lens on this camera.Worth the money.  Easy to carry and store.Pictures are clear and the video works great.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Jennie Schultz
Reviews.Content: I cannot say this enough...I LOVE MY NEW CAMERA !!! I previously owned a Nikon digital camera for 4 years with absolutely no problems until recently when it would not hold a charge & would shut itself off in the process of using it...I love taking pics of family & friends, scenery, & just plain life...when I had the option of getting a new camera, I searched all the Nikon options...then narrowed the list down by doing research on the best fit for me & my needs ! LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera !!!

Reviews.Title: fantastic
Reviews.Author: daniella
Reviews.Content: the last camara i had people kept saying me the pics were not good, with this one, everytime i hear commpliments about the pics!! the zoom is great!!

Reviews.Title: good item thanks
Reviews.Author: elizabeth luengo
Reviews.Content: i search many posibilities before and this is the camera i choose  happy with it. thank you. no more to say

Reviews.Title: This is a great little camera
Reviews.Author: Lois B.
Reviews.Content: I love this for my point and shoot camera when I do not want to carry all my gear. I love the GPS feature and all the effects. It's light and compact.

Reviews.Title: best point and shoot on the market.
Reviews.Author: Dave-az
Reviews.Content: We originally had ordered this camera to have on our wedding trip.  unfortunately do to shipping restraints it was never received.  We did finally get one though and it is simply amazing.  It takes fantastic pictures and has a tremendous amount of options for such a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, great versatility
Reviews.Author: David W. Weiss
Reviews.Content: In its size category this is a fine camera with plenty of extra features. I especially like the 22x zoom along with its compact size.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Camera
Reviews.Author: M.A.FLICK "M.A.FLICK"
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Camera and what nice pictures it takes this a very nice system its kind of a small camera but what quality in such a small package we are very pleased with this purchase Thanks to Amazon Prime.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera for both snapshots and video
Reviews.Author: Robert Travis
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded my expectations.  The pics are sharp and clear and the video surpasses my camcorder videos by far.

Reviews.Title: Ease of Use
Reviews.Author: Diana Hallett
Reviews.Content: Love the ease of operating the camera and the compact sizeto carry in my pocket, purse, around my wrist, etc.The rich red color is easy to spot when laid down.We've taken several beautiful pictures on an easterncarribean cruise and other activities in Florida

Reviews.Title: Wonderful buy, great price.
Reviews.Author: DC 423 "DC"
Reviews.Content: This camera is better than your standard snap and shoot.  And I got it refurbished for about $100 less than what they have listed price at Best Buy.  I love its recording capabilities and the microphone on it for You Tube videos.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures, good video, bad audio
Reviews.Author: L. Shuler
Reviews.Content: I don't know how they got the audio wrong.  It's horrible compared to my 3-year-old Sony WX10 camera.  On the plus side, the picture quality was outstanding.  Wish I'd bought it just for the pictures.

Reviews.Title: looked for a while
Reviews.Author: barbara thomas
Reviews.Content: couldn't find a camera for someone technologically challenged. this one seems to have less adjustments (many can be done automatically) and it produced super pictures! the flash seems to be popping up a lot.  battery did not hold the charge very long. be careful you are not pushing the video button.  i will have to read up more on this for long trips. just bought the camera..so far, so good. i need to do my homework too.

Reviews.Title: Super
Reviews.Author: Rajiv Chopra "Rajiv Chopra"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is a wonderful addition to the SLRs that I have. It is quick, responsive, and takes wonderful pictures

Reviews.Title: Nikon with GPS
Reviews.Author: Arlene "DAP"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I bought it just before we went to Disneyworld in Orlando.  It took the most amazing pictures and videos at night.  The details were so vivid and clear.  It's easy to use.  I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: zoom on in to this great deal
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great camera! Awesome wifi and picture quality. The 22x zoom is really precise, truly amazing and something to see!

Reviews.Title: Great size
Reviews.Author: Hill girl
Reviews.Content: The pixels . Email and the size convenient of this camera were the deciding factor in choosing this camera over other models and makes

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9500 digital camera
Reviews.Author: LGTT
Reviews.Content: I love this nikon camera.  I had the Nikon S8200 and loved it. I have used it for years and it takes great pictures.. I dropped it one to many times though and the lens was out and broke when it fell last time.  I bought the drop, spill protection for this camera also.  The great thing about this camera is that it uses the same batteries as the S8200 so I didn't have to buy any spare batteries or a spare charger.  Only downer on the camera is the flash is on the left side and whenever someone uses my camera - the have their finger on the flash so it won't come up - but once you tell them to move their finger - no issues - works great!  It uses the EN-EL12 3.7v battery.

Reviews.Title: Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Ecologist
Reviews.Content: It's small, compact, yet has amazing zoom and, best of all, it syncs with the iPhone and you can send pictures right away.  Some users have had trouble with the app, but it's worked for me.  It is a minimal app - does little more than put pictures into folders on your phone.  I ordinarily carry around 30 lbs of camera equipment to get closeups, telephotos, etc.  But if I'm just walking to work or going on a short conference trip, i can take this along and have a lot more capacity to take good photos.  The iPhone camera is great, but it has a fixed focal length and a lousy flash.  One shortcoming is the flash pops out where one tends to hold the camera.  Other than that, I'm very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Peggy Graham
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  This is the second Nikon I have owned and love the quality of picture that it takes.  The zoom allows you to get in very close without losing clarity of the picture.

Reviews.Title: This is what I expected.
Reviews.Author: SIVA KRISHNA KOGILI
Reviews.Content: I liked it...It meets my expectations and works great.I have not yet tried GPS. But rest of all working fine.Thanks,Siva Krishna

Reviews.Title: THE RIGHT GRIP !!
Reviews.Author: John Petz
Reviews.Content: It is quite simple... I can turn it on...Take the picture... Then turn it off ... While using only one hand !!! It is the only camera that has a grip for my right thumb to hold, and not a bunch of useless knobs in the way.

Reviews.Title: flash problem
Reviews.Author: abe fuchs
Reviews.Content: the flash is in a very inconvient spot .It pops up where you usually put your left hand to hold the camera.

Reviews.Title: it is cool and perfect potable with you
Reviews.Author: huangfeihong
Reviews.Content: I like it so much, since it is very convent to take anywhere. The photos is very good, and the lens is very useful to use in any circumstance. It also have many functions to make photo taking very convient.

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: Renato Rodrigues
Reviews.Content: Very good point and shot camera. Didn't like the Rec button position, otherwise it takes very good pictures and high quality video

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Thornton "Dr. Billy Bob"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for her trip to New York City with her two daughters and two granddaughters.  We have a full size Nikon but she wanted a small compact one.  She was extremely pleased with it along with the features that the girls figured out.  There were not shortage of pictures on the trip and many of them came back to me in near realtime.She still favors this over the full size camera.  I would strongly recommend it or the newer replacement if one already exists.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!  Well worth the money!
Reviews.Author: Deborah M. Lefelhoc
Reviews.Content: It's small, compact, easy to use.  Does everything we hoped it would do and more!  Would definitely recommend the purchase of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot gift camera
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: My wife loved the red to match her red cell phone and the strong zoom lens.  I like the easy controls and the lens cover.  It makes good photos that allow my wife to be creative.

Reviews.Title: hate flash location
Reviews.Author: Debby
Reviews.Content: Hate where the flash is located. Cannot hold camera and take photo when flash pops up. What happens is a very out of focus photo!

Reviews.Title: Overpriced piece of crap.
Reviews.Author: Amazon sucks
Reviews.Content: First of all, a big thanks to Amazon for selling this for $50 more than Best buy and then not allowing returns for this junk Nikon calls a camera.  Flimsy construction and terrible controls.  The flash pops up whenever it feels like it, and it is positioned terribly.  More often than not your hand or finger will be over it when you actually intend to use it.  I only had it for about two months before the OLED screen completely failed rendering the camera totally useless.  I should have stuck with Canon and I will never buy a Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Nothing surprising
Reviews.Author: JuanDavid
Reviews.Content: Pros:+Image Quality+Zoom+You can pause the video recordingCons:-Battery life-Wired Charger-No focus when you zoom in videos

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after my wife dropped my Nikon s9300 with the lens extended. I loved the s9300 and am very happy with the s9500.

Reviews.Title: THE CAMERA CASE INCLUDED IN THE PURCHASE WILL NOT CLOSE
Reviews.Author: EVAN EVANS
Reviews.Content: The camera came with a bundle of accessories, including a Nikon case for Coolpix cameras. . The  camera will fit inside the case, but the case will not close, resulting in the camera being able to fall out of the case. It was a manufacturing defect of poor design. Consequently one must purchase a seperate carrying case, or hold the camera in their hand at all times to protect it. Shame on Nikon. The camera itself is fairly good.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: PJ Rodgers
Reviews.Content: An excellent camera!  It has so many features one would like such as:  when shutting the camera down the eye automatically closes and protects the lens, so easy to use, lightweight, durable, great wide-angle zoom.  I put a clip on the case and carry on my side or on a hook suspended from either fishing or motorcycle riding gear.  It also has a long-lasting battery, but I purchased an extra one which easily stores in a pocket on the camera case.  The size is ideal for travel and pictures quickly download.

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera
Reviews.Author: T. Sen "Ted"
Reviews.Content: This was my first and last time trying a Nikon Camera. Nikon was a great SLR camera producer in good old days. I had a Nikon professional SLR more than ten years ago, I remember loving that camera.This camera has major mechanical issues. On/off button is kind of numb, you may need to press multiple times to start the camera.The way, the camera works and sounds mechanically feels like it will break in a few months. So I didn't take my chance.Also, pop up flash is an another annoying thing in this camera, when you try to press half way it doesn't pop up and if you press all the way, it opens up and takes the picture without focusing.Flash is a total failure, it takes the pictures in a extremely bright light, you cannot recognize the people. If you take out the flash, then it is very dark.It works well in the day light. But a camera in this level should do a better job.I didn't have any problem connecting it through wifi or using GPS. These works fine.Price dropped sharphly for this camera, even it is now cheaper than some older models. It feels like Nikon knows there is a major issue in this camera and trying to get rid of their inventory and end of manufacturing this camera.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Jazz L
Reviews.Content: I've only had the camera for 2 days now.  I am an amateur picture taker. Mainly pictures of my kid, holidays and family events.  My last camera was a Sony W55 bought 7 years agoPROS:Good menu, not too confusingGreat zoom on viewfinderLove that I can control and take wireless pictures with my smartphone and Nikon app.So far so good in dark lightingCONS:Flash doesn't go back down when you turn camera offFlash in a bad place with finger, so is the shutter buttonFor self portraits with timer: the camera doesn't balance on its side for portrait shots (guess I need a Tripod now)*Maybe there is a firmware update that fixes the first con.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Lynn Liskiewicz "lynn"
Reviews.Content: camera is great. need to learn a lot more about it but the zoom is amazing and the shots are great.

Reviews.Title: Not a very good camera, the focus :(
Reviews.Author: Paul G Bolen
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say that this is the lowest quality Nikon I have ever purchased. I wish I had read the other reviews first. I agree, the focus on this is very bad.

Reviews.Title: so-so
Reviews.Author: Danno
Reviews.Content: Wasn't horribly impressed with the picture quality. Tried some dusk shots in Las Vegas using the night and auto modes. My Samsung Galaxy phone takes better photos. Also, the wifi is rather tricky and they don't tell you that in the manual. You HAVE to make sure the battery is all the way in, your phone (if transferring to it) is fully charged, and the camera is fully charged. Then and only then can you a transfer. Will return to Costco.

Reviews.Title: Excellent but pop up flash problematic.
Reviews.Author: Nick Mantarakis
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera but its pop up flash is placed where you hold the camera and is obstructed from being released when needed.

Reviews.Title: Lense cover
Reviews.Author: james white
Reviews.Content: lense  cover now will not close and open properly, seems to stick in about quarter,  now the battery with not hold a charge for long. love the camera, but will have to look at another at this point

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9500 Superzoom Compact Camera review by Dale (updated 01.11.2013)
Reviews.Author: Dale Thorn
Reviews.Content: NOTE: My Nikon S9500 fell off of my chair onto the floor at home and immediately broke - the lens would no longer retract. I've dropped Canons and Panasonics a hundred times, observing big dents in the lens barrels and bodies, yet they still worked OK. The Nikon S9500 didn't have a scratch on it, yet malfunctioned anyway. I've heard about this problem with other users, but was surprise at how fragile this camera is. I sent it back to Nikon and they want $150 USD to fix it, so I will have to absorb the $350 loss and let them keep it (no point in paying to fix something that fragile that will just break again).Startup time for the S9500 is about one second, and going from minimum zoom to maximum zoom takes about two seconds. Image quality is OK for a camera with a 1/2.33-type sensor, but certain details like hair, or a bird's feathers in a low-contrast part of the bird's body may be smeared somewhat. This is apparently caused by the noise reduction software in the camera, which can't be turned down or off. Pocket cameras that have much larger sensors (and consequently much less zoom) can often produce a better image with less noise, but you have to give up the long zoom, or put up with a much larger camera.Using the S9500 is easy enough, since the menus and controls are pretty well common to most pocket cameras these days. I especially like the separate video button, which has saved me from a lot of missed opportunities. There are a few nitpicks I have with the S9500: I would like to have Spot Focus as an option on the menu, and I would like to have the option to adjust the amount of noise reduction, in case I wanted to do noise reduction on the computer with extra software.Shooting still photos are not much of a problem in good light, because the shutter speed will be high enough and the image stabilizer will help out. If you use a tripod, or place the camera on a solid object so that there is no camera movement at all, you have to remember to turn the image stabilizer off or the images taken will not be sharp and clear. Many of the comments I've seen about blurry images on this type of camera could be due to using the camera on a tripod or placing it on a firm surface, and forgetting to turn the image stabilizer off. Then of course, you have to remember to turn it back on.The S9500's long 550mm effective zoom (focal length) is the key feature here, and even very expensive cameras cannot match the S9500's image quality with subjects such as small birds at a distance, unless those expensive cameras also have a long focal length lens - nearly as long as the S9500 in any case. Where the S9500 differs most from expensive cameras with large sensors (DSLRs mostly) is in wide angle photos, where the lens is zoomed all the way out (i.e. 25mm effective focal length, with the zoom lever pushed toward the 'W' position). Wide angle photos of landscapes, especially with foliage, will show a great deal of smearing. Wide angle photos of large groups of people will show smearing and digital 'Artifacts' on people's faces when the image is viewed at full size on a computer or printed. A camera such as the Nikon Coolpix 'A' will do a much better job with wide angle photos because its sensor is about 15 times larger.Battery life with the S9500 is rated about average for a pocket camera, which I find is good enough for about three hours of use in the local parks, shooting 100 to 300 photos. How many photos you get on a battery charge depends on how many you shoot close together. If you have the camera on most of the time and keep it activated, and take very few shots, the battery will still run down in a few hours due to the LCD screen, to the image stabilizer, and other electronic features that are active when the camera is active. If you don't want to run out of power when you're out shooting photos, you should get a second battery (never, ever get anything except a genuine Nikon battery) and make sure both are charged up before heading out.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Hilary
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice point and shoot camera that has the high quality of a larger camera, but is small enough to fit in my clutch or pocket. I attend a lot of concerts, and was also looking for a camera with a really good zoom functionality. This camera is AMAZING! I went to a concert last weekend and took the best pictures I've ever taken. The scene options are great, and the camera is really easy to use. My only complaint (even though I love this camera) is that the flash pops up when needed, and you have to push it down manually when done with the flash. The wifi feature is really cool too!! I couldn't find how to use the wifi in the instruction manual (you would think that would be in there!) so I had to watch a video on youtube to teach me how to use it, but once I watched that, I found that it was pretty simple to use. I just purchased this last week so I'm still learning it's capabilities but so far it is by far the best camera I've ever owned!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Karin Klingman
Reviews.Content: good zoom, clear photos, many options.  The battery that came with the camera was dead, fortunately I had ordered a spare battery separately.  I haven't figured out all the options, the directions are very basic, both in the written material that comes with the camera and on-line, but so far the camera is intuitive enough to use I have gotten what I wanted to do accomplished.

Reviews.Title: I like it after I got it fixed
Reviews.Author: Eugene Schott
Reviews.Content: The memory stick was not for this camera so I had to send it in and get related which took 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: Very Annoying buzzing sound
Reviews.Author: china2rider
Reviews.Content: I thought this was going to be a great camera, and it is for still shots. But I started to take short video clips about 6 months ago and sending them via google drive to friends and family..thus no added music, editing, etc. When the lens moves in and out, there is a loud buzzing sound. REALLY loud. It is not noticeable when you actually take the video, but when you upload it onto a computer and play it, you can hear it. Very obnoxious. I bought this at a local camera shop, and when I went to return it and complain about that, they told me you are not supposed to move the lens in and out when taking the video, but rather shut it off, move the zoom, then restart. That sounded crazy to me. I tried to find some info via various google searches, but all I found were complaints about this same issue. Don't buy this if you are planning to use the video option.

Reviews.Title: Don't order the package deal
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras after being a long-time user of the S600.  I love it, hence the 5 stars.  However, I also bought the recommended Case Logic TBC-302 FFP Compact Camera Case (Black) that was part of a deal.  Beware, the camera doesn't fit this case.  How this was recommended is beyond me.  The S9500 kicks the S600's butt.

Reviews.Title: Still evaluating
Reviews.Author: Terryp
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for two days, and have already taken some great pictures with it. But I've found a few things that concern me as well. (1) The auto-focus doesn't work very well when taking close-ups. Even when my subject is well-lit and has good detail in the auto-focus area, I watch as the camera runs right through the proper focus and gives up. It's frustrating, and there's no option to focus manually. (2) When the sepia effect is selected, the camera will not focus on anything, at any range. It seems to pause at the proper focus point when pressing the shutter button half-way, but then jumps out of focus. I suspect that the 'soft' effect is being applied, but when it shouldn't be. But there is a work-around: just shoot in color or black and white, and then apply the sepia effect. (3) The battery icon only has two levels: full and nearly depleted. I was initially impressed by how long the battery seemed to be lasting until I saw the icon change after less than 100 shots. It takes several hours to recharge in the camera. The S9500 has some great features, but they could have picked some more useful ones than 'shrink face' and 'enlarge eyes' (why would anyone want to use those?!), like blur background and manual focus. All-in-all, I'm impressed with the camera so far. It's a giant leap from my CoolPix 3700, if that's saying anything.Update:After using the camera for several weeks, I'm still happy with the picture quality, but auto-focus requires a LOT of light. It's really frustrating trying to use the camera indoors, even with good room lighting, and constantly getting the red brackets, meaning that it's not able to focus. If you plan on taking many indoor pictures, I'd strongly recommend against this camera.Another gripe is that the self-timer has only two settings: 2 and 10 seconds. What good is the shorter interval? Who can sprint fast enough to make that useful? It should be at least 5 seconds.

Reviews.Title: OK camera but with problems
Reviews.Author: Robert Chance
Reviews.Content: This camera has a few problems. First it doesn't have a view finder. That might not seem like a problem till you go to somewhere like the beach were you are submersed in light. You can not see the screen in these conditions so you can't frame the picture. Second,when using the zoom the camera has a hard time getting focused. This is a real problem.

Reviews.Title: Camera was hard to operate.
Reviews.Author: Chester Sulborski
Reviews.Content: Didn't offer as many photo options as my $100 Olympus camera. The photo's were good but the over-all ease of operation was not there for me!!

Reviews.Title: Not good for low light (concerts)
Reviews.Author: MeL0NheaD 3
Reviews.Content: I moved from a Sony HD55 which was great (dropped it in water), to a Sony HD70 which was also great but i broke the zoom lens. (also my fault)...  In reading review upon review... i went with this camera.  outside and natural light photos turn out great.  However, I predominately use my camera for concerts.  The Sony was spot on amazing for such, especialy on just the default AUTO settings.  This camera, not at all.  90% of the pics are blurry.  especially if using ANY zoom.  I can stand perfectly still, allow it to focus, get the green box showing focused, and it will take a blurry picture almost gauranteed.  Never have i had that on a camera.  shooting video in soft or lower light (say the living room with one lamp on) turns out pretty dim also.  Other than those, the camera would be great... unfortunately for me and how i use the camera, its a deal breaker and i'm getting rid of it and going to go back to my Sony.  I'm not a Sony "fanboy", but they've just proven tried and true for my camera habits.

Reviews.Title: Nikon vs Lumix...
Reviews.Author: Gazzy 1
Reviews.Content: Well presented camera with good build quality and features... if they would just work properly. I have already experienced problems with it, like having to switch in on and off when it won't continue to take photos.I mean on the very first day!!! I have had Lumix cameras for the last 8 years and NEVER had this problem before. Picture quality is ok under about 12 x Zoom. At full zoom it has a "comic" picture effect. Once again not as good as a Lumix FZ40. Flash effectiveness, at close up range is fine, but at 5 metres or more, poor quality. So overall I am disappointed, and in reality I will use my  bulkier Lumix 90% of the time, so this was pretty much a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...
Reviews.Author: André
Reviews.Content: Its a great point and shoot camera. The 22x zoom helps a lot to take good pictures in open areas.

Reviews.Title: i need an english manual!
Reviews.Author: w2
Reviews.Content: i have features i need to read, but the manual is japanese. i paid for it, didn't I! please forward me one, thanks!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: rebecca
Reviews.Content: very nice camera, but i didnt understand how to use it. to technical for me. it arrived on time and in good condition , but had to send it back.

Reviews.Title: Cheep made
Reviews.Author: JF McClendon
Reviews.Content: Battery door design is poor focus is not clear not well made I like me poor Coolpix much better. Old is better!

Reviews.Title: Only one flaw so far.
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about a month now and I really like the pictures. The only problem is that the cord doesn't work to charge the battery or to connect to the computer. I don't know if I just have a bad cord or there is something wrong with the camera. It doesn't really matter since my computer reads SD cards and I purchased a separate battery charger.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Anderson
Reviews.Content: I have had an initial look at this camera and already think I am going to really enjoy using it once I have got used to all the features. A great product.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Seth Schroeder "Tech Industry Professional"
Reviews.Content: Great camera so far with the little I have used it. Most of the reviews I read before purchasing were about "lemons" and not about the actual camera so I thought I would take the plunge. I didn't get it on Amazon, went with BB and their 3 year protection so I can take it into the store to get it fixed. I love amazon though and purchased my batteries on here with my prime membership.So in the end no issues yet with my limited time and after all my research if you want a small camera with over 12x zoom this is the one to opt for. There are samsung cameras out there but for the very slight (60-100) bump in price you get 30% more MP and 20% more zoom. Not to mention Nikon lenses that are the usually the best out there.

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: Milton Santos
Reviews.Content: it does what it promises. I just missed the possibility to take panoramic pictures in this model. It would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: VERY fragile
Reviews.Author: Love to read
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement for the 9100, which has been working very well, but after years the software wasn't quite up to speed. We love to hike, and took the 9500 to Yosemite National Park after owning it for 1 month. As I carried it, it bumped into a railing, and refused to work. Nikon called it "dropped", and refused to honor the warantee - so I can either pay $150 for a "repaired camera" or $250 for a new one. . .I'm NOT happy with Nikon that seems to look for any reason not to cover what should have been a 1 year warantee.The camera worked great - loved the features, but if one can't take this camera out of a cloistered environment, what's the point?

Reviews.Title: Overall criticism
Reviews.Author: Van L. Cox
Reviews.Content: Awkward placement of on-off button; slow recovery for follow-up pics, searching for stored images.I do not have six more words.

Reviews.Title: Sony wi-fi camara
Reviews.Author: Sonia I. Cubero
Reviews.Content: Great camara however instruction for setting a little bit ambiguous for me. Will love to have Sony spend some money on better, easier to follow instructions. More detail.

Reviews.Title: What good is it if it doesn't work
Reviews.Author: jim smucker
Reviews.Content: I gave it one star because I couldn't give it no stars. It was a Christmas gift and when my girlfriend opened it, it said "lens error" and wouldn't turn on. What good is that?

Reviews.Title: Seems to be a good camera
Reviews.Author: kheimy
Reviews.Content: We have only had this camera for about a month. We took it on vacation and got some really good photos. We are still working out a few of the settings and trying to figure out how to do better pictures in action but all in all a pretty nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Image quality sucks, regret every peny spent on it
Reviews.Author: H&S; "Tallica's"
Reviews.Content: The camera is great until you reach the time to see the photo quality, compression! the photo quality is compressed, didn't like it at all, why didn't I get me a canon or other brand, the S8400 was better but it had some dirt in the ccd compartment as well, why did I bought this?! crazy!

Reviews.Title: Flash was broke
Reviews.Author: cathie brown
Reviews.Content: When I went to use this the flash was brokeGot it. For a gift and have to. Work with it till the flash works

Reviews.Title: lens casts shadow or improperly closes when doing closeups
Reviews.Author: Fairbanksan
Reviews.Content: I had the Nikon Coolpix S 9300 and liked it alot better.The S 9500 casts a shadow when using closeup and zoom features in a low-light situation and also this situation with flash.  Has anyone else had this problem?Also, the flash does not retract automatically each time when I close the camera.I need to keep this one in a case because it opens when inside purse or bag and then likely to scratch lens (problem with my S 9300Lens shadow with closeups is a big problem and may cause me to return the camera.

Reviews.Title: A great and feature-rich camera!
Reviews.Author: L. Jodell McLemore
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It is small enough to carry around and it takes great pictures. I have not used the Wi-FI option yet, so I cannot comment on this feature.

Reviews.Title: I sent this product back..
Reviews.Author: Arachne "Born to be wild."
Reviews.Content: ...and therefore cannot rate it.  Upon delivery it was refused as I had chosen something else.  I am sorry that I could no it be of more help.

Reviews.Title: This camera broke within a month of purchase!
Reviews.Author: Leslie Szabo
Reviews.Content: I found this camera to be a bit confusing to learn all the features. Then I dropped it onto a carpet from coffee table height and the lens will not shut. It is unusable!
